Module FantasyRealmsTM
Package client

Class BoardController

java.lang.Object
client.BoardController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class BoardController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for the the board vista. Holds all object necessary for drawing the board.
Author:
Tereza Miklóšová

    • gotAllCards

      public static java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean gotAllCards
      Checks if the player got all the beginning 7 cards from the server. Until this is true, the window wont be drawn.

    • stack_hand1

      public javafx.scene.layout.StackPane stack_hand1
      Stack panes for hand holding image of the card and the button to put the card to table. Together the 8 stack panes represent the hand of the player. The hand is automatically sorted by the type of the card.

    • stack_table1

      public javafx.scene.layout.StackPane stack_table1
      Stack panes holding card images and buttons for taking the card from the table to hand. Together the 10 stack panes represent the table. Cards are going to the panes from left to the right. First free gets filled.

      private javafx.scene.control.Button deck_Button

    • label_player1

      private javafx.scene.control.Label label_player1
      Labels for all possible players joining the game. They contain player's name and at the end of the game also his score. The labels change background color depending on who is the current playing player.

    • label_score

      private javafx.scene.control.Label label_score
      A label with player's name. At the end of the game, the label holds text informing about the end of the game.

    • MAX_TEXT_HEIGHT

      private final double MAX_TEXT_HEIGHT
      The maximum height of card text area for bonuses and penalties.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • hand_StackPaneFree

      private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​Tuple<java.lang.Boolean,​SimplifiedCard>> hand_StackPaneFree
      Map of hand elements. Key is the name of the stack pane, value is a tuple where the first value is whether the stack pane is free or not. The second value holds a simplified card object if the pane is not free. Null otherwise.

    • table_StackPaneFree

      private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,​Tuple<java.lang.Boolean,​SimplifiedCard>> table_StackPaneFree
      Map of table elements. Key is the name of the stack pane, value is a tuple where the first value is whether the stack pane is free or not. The second value holds a simplified card object if the pane is not free. Null otherwise.

    • create_card_from_text

      public void create_card_from_text​(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane sp, SimplifiedCard card)
      Method draws the card on the given StackPane by the information contained in SimplifiedCard object.
      Parameters:
      sp - StackPane to put the drawn card into.
      card - Contains information about the data needed for drawing the card.

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Method for initializing the board. Contains all necessary preparations of the board and all its components.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - Url for initialization.
      resourceBundle - Resource bundle for UI texts.

    • crate_hand_SimplifiedCards

      private void crate_hand_SimplifiedCards()
      Method for creating all cards in player's hand to stack panes.

    • getCardFromDeck

      public void getCardFromDeck()
      Sends message to server to give the player the first card from deck. Disables the first action buttons and enables the second action buttons as we already used our first action (draw from deck or take card from table).

    • putCardOnTable

      public void putCardOnTable​(SimplifiedCard card)
      Puts a card to the table. Doing that based on the messages received from the server.
      Parameters:
      card - Card to draw to the table.

    • getCardFromTable

      private void getCardFromTable​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
      Get the card under the button to the hand.
      Parameters:
      e - The event from the button click.

    • repaintAllCards

      private void repaintAllCards()
      Repaints all cards in hand after some action that changes it. Before painting the cards are sorted by type.

    • switchNameForStackPane

      public javafx.scene.layout.StackPane switchNameForStackPane​(java.lang.String name)
      Get the stack pane by its name.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the stack pane.
      Returns:
      Object of the named stack pane.

    • putCardToHand

      public void putCardToHand()
      Puts a new card in hand.

    • removeCardFromTable

      public void removeCardFromTable​(int id)
      Removes a card from the table to be the same as the server has the table filled.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the card that should be removed from the table.

    • dropCard

      private void dropCard​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
      Drops card from hand. Repaints all cards to reflect the change.
      Parameters:
      e - The button event from clicking on it.

    • changeLabel

      public java.lang.String changeLabel​(javafx.scene.control.Label label, java.lang.String toAdd)
      At the end of the game changes the colors of the labels and its text to fit the winning statistics.
      Parameters:
      label - Which label should be repainted.
      toAdd - Text of the score to add to the label.
      Returns:
      String with the name and score of the player on the label.

    • buildPlayerScores

      public void buildPlayerScores​(java.lang.String[] names)
      Processes the information from the server about scores of the players. Prints a dialogue window about the statistics. Changes the texts and colors of the labels in the process.
      Parameters:
      names - Names of the players that should have their scores changed.

    • disconnectedFromServer

      public void disconnectedFromServer()
      When a connection error happens, this method prints an alert.

    • buildPlayerLabels

      public void buildPlayerLabels​(java.lang.String[] names)
      Method builds player labels by the information biven by the server to the client. Method build the exact number of labels needed and fills them with player names.
      Parameters:
      names - Player names in order from this player. Starting player has a special tag before its name.

    • enableFirstActionButtons

      public void enableFirstActionButtons​(boolean enable)
      This method enables or disables the buttons for first action in the round. (Cards on the table or the deck).
      Parameters:
      enable - True if to enable. False if to disable.

    • enableStackPaneString

      private void enableStackPaneString​(java.lang.String stackPaneName, boolean enable)
      Changes the appearance of the stack pane string.
      Parameters:
      stackPaneName - Stack pane in which to change the appearance.
      enable - True if enable the text to full opacity. False if the text should be less visible.

    • enableSecondActionButtons

      public void enableSecondActionButtons​(boolean enable)
      Enables or disables the buttons for cards in hand.
      Parameters:
      enable - True if to enable. False if to disable.

    • setNextPlayer

      private void setNextPlayer()
      Changes the active player label. If the active player is the first one (us), enables the first action buttons.

    • changeActiveLabel

      private void changeActiveLabel​(int indexOfPlayerNew)
      Changes the active label from one to another. Repaints the labels.
      Parameters:
      indexOfPlayerNew - The index of new active player.

    • putEndGameTextOnLabel

      public void putEndGameTextOnLabel()
      Puts an informative text on a label that the game has already ended.
